channel.title: Valentine's day
channel.description: why not? What are your plans? and general discussion about love. One Night stands or long relationships? Discuss!

item.title: Valentine's day
item.dc:creator: CatzEyes93
item.description:
geekofalltrades:

Well, I bought a rose and gave it to an amazing young woman, but it turns out she already has a boyfriend (I guess? I’ve been talking to her quite a bit and she sure never mentioned him), so I’m going to be playing TF2, watching TV, hitting the gym, and doing homework. Unless someone asks me out. My fingers ain’t crossed for that, though.

Geek: Here is a rose for you… and happy Valentines day!

Amazing woman: Aw, how sweet! But I already have a boyfriend

Geek: Shucks that’s alright sweet-cakes. Just consider this a small gift from your next boyfriend. :3

Read full topic

item.title: Valentine's day
item.dc:creator: Havelok
item.description:
lulz.

In all honesty I think it effects women more than men to be alone on vday.

I generally avoid starting relationships before today specifically because of the holiday, which is difficult because generally the best time in the world to find someone to hook up with is between December 25th and February 14.

a) they want someone to kiss on new years

b) they don’t want to be a loner on valentines day

and c) Late winter/Early Spring is statistically the time of year that more females actively seek a mate. Its in the genes or something.

A new relationship going through valentines day is… more trouble than its worth, I’ve found. More often than not you go to some effort making the day special for them and they leave you a couple weeks later.

My tactic is to wait until after its over and see who is actually still interested. They might be a little irked that I didn’t “find them” before valentines day, but if they are genuinely into you than they will get over it quickly.

Read full topic

item.title: Valentine's day
item.dc:creator: DansonDelta40
item.description:
Sitting at home, having sent a Valentine E-Card to my ex, along with a text message on her mobile phone, telling her that she has mail.

That was six hours ago, and still no answer. Feelin’ fine, though. Nothing like a little depression to keep me going.

Small question: If a sitcom like “Scrubs” brings you to tears, should a therapy be started any day soon?

Read full topic

item.title: Valentine's day
item.dc:creator: bigfan421
item.description:
TBH tomorrows gonna suck for me.

  1. Every other lazy moron’s gonna be purchasing whatever the hell we have left for their significant other (my store started reconfiguring its seasonal aisle again, so johnny-come-lately is basically screwed)
  2. Seeing as Its a Sunday, a rather large portion of the community has to buy groceries b/c the other six days are insufficient.

(and I wont even get Holiday pay for it )

Read full topic

item.title: Valentine's day
item.dc:creator: Fancy_Pants
item.description:
It’s kind of gross that people are expecting so much romantic love bullshit to happen on valentines day. It’s just another day, if you love someone express it every day, not just one day out of the year. Nobody should expect to receive things either.
